snippet: A federal judge in Texas refused to halt an injunction he had placed on the president’s immigration actions, saying they would be harmful.
abstract: Federal Judge Andrew S Hanen angrily refuses to halt injunction he had placed on implementation of Pres Obama's immigration executive actions in Texas; repeats argument that executive actions exceeded presidential authority, and accuses Justice Dept of lying to him; defiance comes despite signals from Fifth Circuit appeals court that it could rule in White House's favor.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Texas refused to halt an injunction he had placed on the president’s immigration actions, saying they would be harmful.

headline.main: Judge Refuses to Let Obama’s Executive Actions on Immigration Proceed
headline.print_headline: Judge Refuses to Let Obama’s Executive Actions on Immigration Proceed
